title: Violence alters human genes for generations, researchers discover
dot:
digraph HamaMassacreImpact{rankdir=TB;node[shape=box, style=rounded];HamaMassacre[label="1982 Hama Massacre
(Syrian government besieged Hama,
killing tens of thousands)"];Rebellion[label="Rebellion Against Assad
(Rebels used the memory of Hama
to inspire the toppling of the Assad family)"];GeneticImpact[label="Genetic Impact
(Stress-induced epigenetic changes
passed to grandchildren of survivors)"];ResearchTeam[label="Research Team
(Connie Mulligan, Rana Dajani,
Catherine Panter-Brick)"];StudyDesign[label="Study Design
(Three generations of Syrian families,
including Hama survivors and controls)"];Findings[label="Findings
(14 epigenetic modifications in grandchildren,
21 in direct survivors,
accelerated epigenetic aging)"];EmpathyPolicy[label="Empathy & Policy
(Understanding trauma's intergenerational impact
can inform policy and empathy)"];Resilience[label="Human Resilience
(Families persevered, living fulfilling lives
despite trauma)"];HamaMassacre->Rebellion;HamaMassacre->GeneticImpact;GeneticImpact->ResearchTeam;ResearchTeam->StudyDesign;StudyDesign->Findings;Findings->EmpathyPolicy;Findings->Resilience;}
